duties_responsibilities.duty: Identify, develop, and support the selection of new equipment and new processes across the enterprise.
Apply both standard and advanced engineering techniques to drive reductions in cost while ensuring high quality and exceptional service.
Independently develop clear and specific objectives for given assignments that may require the investigation of several alternative solutions.
Contribute to long-term thinking and planning for improvement.
Develop expertise as an SME on manufacturing equipment.
Provide guidance to co-ops, technicians, and other engineers.
Effectively participate in a team setting to achieve results.
Effectively lead assigned projects of moderate to large scope for assessments or implementations of new manufacturing equipment or processes.
Assess current manufacturing equipment and processes and make recommendations on future solutions for equipment and processes.
Recommend and/or create and execute plans for process improvements and new processes based on expected results.
Identify, create, and apply best practices and standards within the operations group.
Provide analytical problem solving and process troubleshooting support in area of expertise.
Analyze or interpret process changes in a complex manner (e.g. DOE, DFMEA, PFMEA).
Actively support the development of co-ops, technicians, and engineers.
Complete project definitions, Exhibit A/EPA, and CEPM as required on projects.
Be a corporate resource for technical questions concerning manufacturing processes and equipment.
Communicate progress through management updates and team meetings.

education_certification.credential: BS degree in a technical field plus appropriate continuous training
